description:
Highly recommended spot for a tasty Indian meal! 

This is a reasonably priced and clean place, and not as crowded as many other restaurants in SF.
I've been going here for 4 years and have been impressed by the food and service.
author: Martin L.

description:
Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 3.5/5
Overall:  One of my favorites in the area!  Always a good option for Indian in my mind.

The extended review...

Food:

Lamb Saag - Spinach and lamb!?!?  Yes please!  The portion of meat is fairly decent and I probably order this because eating spinach makes me feel a little healthier 

Garlic Naan - Always have to have some Naan with dinner.  A fairly standard tasting Naan which compliments the meal.

Service: Friendly and attentive service.

Ambiance: There's some Bollywood in the background.  A very casual setting.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Wow!   I never get to eat Indian food bc my family doesn't like it, but I had the night to myself and ordered here!  Absolutely one of the best Indian dishes I've ever had.   

I had the butter chicken and the saag paneer and naan and it was DELICIOUS!  The butter sauce melted in your mouth!   

Highly recommended this place!!
author: Amie B.

description: My favorite Indian restaurant! I come here both for take out or dining in. The staff is always on point, friendly, and efficient. The food is amazing! Chicken dishes offer very tender chicken. The sauces are fresh. And the food is always hot. Came here once with someone that had a food allergy and they went above and beyond to accommodate their needs. I've never had a bad experience.
author: Alan H.

description:
My 2 friends and I came here for lunch on a Wednesday, and it was basically empty. There were 2 other parties there. The interior was very spaciousOn the bright side, the service was very attentive and fast.

We ordered samosas, tikki masalas, and butter chicken with garlic naan. I didn't care much for the samosas, but the other two dishes were tasty with generous portions. The highest spicy level is *very* spicy! I can definitely see why this place is so popular for take-out. I'll probably do that next time.
author: Thu P.

description:
I ordered takeout here and the food was ready decently fast.

I got the Lamb Curry. The lamb was really well cooked and tender! The flavor was good and it had a good amount of tomatoes and vegetables but the curry was a little watery.

The food was a little pricey especially because they charge extra for rice but I would come back.
author: Michelle L.

description: Excellent prompt service on a Saturday night.  The dine-in attendance was a a little below 50% capacity so it wasn't too busy or in too high demand.  The food came pretty quick.  Pros - excellent Daal soup with a large portion with some veggies in it.  The naan texture was good and chewy.  Ask for super mild spice, we went ehhh in the middle, and it was way too hot and it drowns out the rich Indian spices which is a shame.  The flavor is still there and it's great, but the heat factor will get you.
author: Patrick O.

description: Tasty curry, came here solely based on reviews, they have this eggplant curry that has a hard boiled egg in it, they mash it up and it makes the curry taste totally different.  The curries were complex and unique. The naan was on point. Staff was friendly and welcoming.
author: Jay H.

description: This is the best Indian food I've had in the city. They made it spicy enough for me which is hard to fine. Naan is great and portions and prices are fair. Amazing quick delivery I was so happy I got it two days in a row.
author: Lydia G.

description:
I recently came here with my hubs and two little ones and I can honestly say it was the best Indian food I've ever had at a restaurant. My bff is Indian and her moms food is bomb so, just saying. 
We had mixed tandoori, saag paneer, butter chicken, navaratna korma and butter naan. It's really nice that they ask how spicy you'd like the dishes esp if you have a sensitivity to spice or are dining with kids. The service was great. Our server was sweet, attentive and made conversation with our children, which is always really nice and good for them to learn manners and how to interact at a restaurant. Hoping to go back next week without kids for some spice. This place will be our new jam :)
author: Mimi C.

description:
WHHHY has no one introduced me to biryani until now??? We ordered the lamb version, which was bomb. I don't even like lamb all that much but this joint was bellissimo. 
And then the butter chicken tikka masala, also beautiful. 
I skipped the samosas which I'm kind of regretting now based on how delicious everything else tasted. 

I'm considering relocating to castro for their butter chicken.
author: Jess K.

description: Clean place and good service but food (chicken biryani) was probably the worst biryani i've tried - watery, little meat, and didn't look appetizing.
author: Major G.

description:
This joint has seen a bunch of re-incarnations.
This one has achieved Brahmin level.
At least for our singular meal.
Lamb Shank - sauce outta this world.
Salmon Saag Curry - medium spicy was quite hot so be careful what you ask for.
Naan - lots of Naan - insanely good.
We liked this better overall than Amber India - our other go-to quality Indian food place.

Also - this place is acoustically quiet which is a nice change from the never ending trend of having to yell across the table.
author: Anthony A.

description:
This has become sort of my go to delivery place. I love the Himalayan dumplings. For the price that's equivalent to an entre, I would have prefered they give me a couple more to make a meal...

The lamb shank was really good too. ALWAYS eat it freshly cook. I ate a few bites but was full from the dumpling so I thought I keep it for the next day and lamb meat turns into cardboard...should have known better ...kinda ruined a perfectly done dish. 

My recent okra was a complete disaster, don't ever order it. In fact, every Indian place screws it up. The portion was generous. But they cooked down the okra to mush and used really old stemy ones. It was like chewing lemon grass stems (without the nice flavor) and I threw out most of it. 

Their delivery is on time, efficient and friendly.
author: Xiu L.

description:
Sometimes on Sunday nights all you want is to order in and binge watch TV. It's healthy for the soul. 

Ordered delivery for the first time tonight and I am impressed. Delivery was fast!! (40 minutes) and the food was on par with the delectable Indian food I used to get in San Jose. I ordered the tikka masala (spicy), basmati rice, naan, and an order of samosas. 

I like my heat so I think spicy was perfect for me but for others it might be a little hot. I definitely reached for water a few times during my Netflix and chill. Chicken was a little dry but the rich sauce made up for it. Rice was aromatic and perfectly cooked as well. 

The highlight was the samosas which were super crispy on the outside and perfectly mushy and seasoned on the inside. Mint chutney is on point.

Overall great find and will order from them again! :)
author: Shelley B.

description: This is my go-to to-go Indian place. Great-tasting food all-around, I usually get their Shahi Paneer. Are they associated with Royal Indian up the street on Fillmore? I swear they have the same exact recipes.
author: Jay M.

description: Got takeout. Ordered samosas, chicken tikka masala, wings and garlic nann. I'm still hungry. What I got was FANTASTIC, but I thought the Masala would come with rice (basically was chicken soup), the wings had not meat on them (basically eating bones and onions). The samosas were delicious. Flavors were wonderful. Expected more food for $33. I'm not morbidly obese, in case you're wondering
author: Michael B.

description: I ordered delivery from Tara last night and it did not disappoint. I only like chicken tikka masala and Tara definitely does it right. I will definitely be ordering from them again in the future! Oh yeah, and the order got here almost 30 minutes before it's original estimated delivery time so that was awesome too!
author: Kathryn G.

description: Wow do I love this spot!!! I wish that I could I can give it a 10 star. I've had Indian spots in San Francisco for the last 10 years never had car in the Indian cuisine and it is by far better than any other spot I've had. My favorite dish is the lamb chops off the  tandoori menu. The chicken tikka masala was delicious a nice thick creamy sauce hands down better than any other place I've had in San Francisco. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family and anyone else is reading this review.
author: johnny W.

description: Best Indian food we have had in this city!  Delivered to our door in 22 min. We are now big fans!
author: kem t.

description:
I was disappointed with my delivery order. The sag paneer, which we ordered mild (with a note that it was for a child) was too spicy for my daughter to eat. The chicken tikka kebab was dry and not very tasty.

On the positive side, my husband enjoyed the malai kofta, we all enjoyed the kabuli naan, the portion sizes were generous, and the food arrived quickly.
author: Ellen S.

description: The best quality of this cuisine I have ever had. Super fresh and intricately flavorful. Try the saag aloo. It's my favorite. We have never had a bad delivery experience from this place. Worth every cent.
author: Stanley J.

description:
This is one of my 2 go-to Indian restaurants in San Francisco. Come if you want delicious food with a quiet and spiffy ambiance. I've been here heaps of times and will continue to recommend this great spot to my friends. 

Note: I was dining here when a man had come in 30 minutes prior to closing and the staff pushed back and told him they were closing.
author: Leeyen R.

description:
Walked into this lovely place for a rather late dinner on a Sunday. The service was quick and the staff were very friendly. We just ordered butter chicken and naan. I'm happy to say that never had I ever had such a fluffy fresh naan outside of India. The butter chicken was also excellent -- soft and the chicken is just cooked right. 
Tldr: the quality of the food is awesome and I'd recommend this place to all my friends.
author: Gaurav K.

description:
My go to Indian restaurant for delivery--their naan weathers the trek across the city well! Restaurant is casual with no wait  

FOOD: 
- Paneer tikka masala--this is my favorite paneer tikka I've had in the Bay Area so far. The paneer comes in larger pieces so you have the pleasure of breaking it apart. This affords you the experience of the density and body paneer has, unappreciated pre-Tara. The paneer in this dish isn't as browned as in the other paneer dishes I've had, which I appreciate for the softer texture and flavor. I find biting into it thrilling!

- Saag paneer--large pieces of paneer are a delight, and not something I knew I wanted until they arrived in my Eat24 order from Tara. The curry itself is of course delicious--plenty of spinach and not overboard on the cream. Though I feel very full about 3/4 of the way through, I never feel as though I have eaten myself into heavy oblivion (always a risk for me with delicious Indian!). 
 
- Naan--I love it! It's a like a naan/roti hybrid when it comes to texture, a little chewy with just the right amount of oil to impart flavor but not excess grease. I'm not sure if the "chewier naan" is authentic or not (I usually receive a more bready variety), but it certainly keeps much better as takeout than the bready variety (so oft stale and cold by the time it arrives). 

- Vegetarian momo--among the more flavorful momo I've had. While the wrapper was stuck to the steamer basket and the other momo, I thought the well spiced interior (cinnamon? Cumin?) and the flavorful dip made up for it. Ate every last one!

- Mango lassi--on the more yogurty, tart side. Not too sweet or thick, which makes it a refreshing accompaniment to the meal. 

- Rice--basmati and flavorful. Grains are not as long as they come. Aroma is nice.

SERVICE: the servers are incredibly kind and attentive. We were checked on several times throughout the meal and water was refilled without asking.  

AMBIANCE: this is excellent for a casual meal. I appreciate the environment for what it is--there's wood cutout wainscoting, bare hipster bulbs amid older fashioned soft yellow lamps, and paintings of sculptures (less complicated than it sounds).  

For those on the polish patrol, the interior is a little musty, the carpets are a touch past their prime, and  the ceiling tiles are of the perforated white variety I would count in middle school to pass the time.  But this makes sense for the price point and does not merit star deduction. Come for the food and enjoy the restaurant for what it is!
author: Helen W.

description: My third time trying Indiana food, by far this is the best place I tried. To start there customer service was excellent! I had the Garlic Naan and omg the best and for the price cant get better. Also the Seera rice and Lamb rogan where delicious. Im definitely coming back with the rest of my family. I also liked the decor inside Its unique and it tops off a wonderful experience
author: Yamili C.

description: My go to indian delivery place. The Shahi Paneer is delicious and the rice is amazing. The delivery says they are gonna be late but they're pretty good about being on time.
author: Rohan D.

description:
SO GOOD

Garlic Naan +  Chicken Tikka Masala
- such a good combination and the taste is on point! you just wanna keep going after the first bite
- everything served boiling and steaming hot so be careful!

although this place is 150% the price of other Indian joints, the convenience and the consistent quality and the no-stomachache post Indian food experience is what keeps me coming back
author: Tina A.

description:
Food:  So delicious, freshly made very decent classic Indian food. 
Service:  Superb! 
Physical space:  Too traditional to the point it just looks old not really thoughtfully decorated,  and for God`s sake this humongous screen TV`s in every Indian restaurant which constantly play Indian Music Videos, I believe is a huge disappointment.  I love Indian culture, music, art etc.  but I don`t think it has to be constantly forced into your face just because you want to have some good Indian Food.  I wish someone opened an extremely contemporary/modern, chic place where they served the most traditional, hard core Indian Food. 
ps: When they say spicy hot,  they mean it!!  I did cry a bit while I was eating it but it was a mixed feeling of pain&pleasure so I loved it!! I definitely recommend!
author: Sonya I.

description: Delicious Indian food!! I got the chicken korma and it was incredibly yummy. Generous portions and great garlic naan bread! The chicken tikka masala wasn't my favorite, but having lived in the U.K. for awhile I know I'm pretty picky about that particular dish. Not bad, just not great. Everything else was fantastic!
author: Amanda V.

description:
Tiki Salmon was fantastic, the garlic naan was more buttery than expected but good. Lacha paratha was okay. kadhai paneer was okay, more tomato-y than I typically like Indian food. Veg Pakora was okay, hard to keep it crispy with takeout, I get it.

Some confusion on my takeout as it said 20-30 min on yelp, then I got an email saying 60-70min, but it was actually 20-30min as stated.
author: Brice P.

description: This place was a welcome surprise. I stumbled upon this place when it was pretty late and I was looking to have dinner in the area. The decor and ambience was nothing over the top yet refreshing with the cleanly set tables and walls reminding of murals from buddhist caves.The place was not too crowded when I arrived here around 9:30 pm. Its open till late-10:30pm. Service was nice. When ordering biryani, I chose very spicy one in terms of spice level. I was so happy with the kick of spice and glad that it was not a muted version of spicy. The samosas and papad were decent. They did serve me ice on request.
author: Tejashree M.

description: Really enjoyed the great Indian favor. Everything we had was wonderful.  Great white table cloth atmosphere.
author: Uni K.

description: At times too salty lamb shank and okra and did not hit the right notes. Better kulfi then most but a but icy less creamy. Biriyani seems to be old white rice used. 4/5 for Bay Area not Fremont or Sunnyvale standards though. Better variety than most Indian places around here
author: Kimi W.

description: The naan was really great. Naan and rice did not come included with my chicken tikka masala. The portions were fair. Service was good. Nice ambiance.
author: Tilly D.

description: Some of the best Indian food I've ever had. Amazing food, and good services. Will come again soon.
author: Alexis S.

description:
The Papadam tasted like it had been cooked in old oil - horrible. The Salad did not taste fresh either - the tomatoes tasted old. The Daal soup was watery and flavorless. The Salmon Tandoori, however was good. 

Regardless, this place is obviously not changing their oil frequently or keeping things fresh. My friend made a good comparison. This was like drinking city tap water instead of spring water. Take from that what you will. Would not order from here again. I hope they step up their game!!
author: Delilah W.

description:
Great Indian food, great service, big plates, and really fair  price!! 
Defently recommended
author: Carmel L.

description: Extremely fast delivery. Always deliver with a smile. Could be spicer despite my requests. A tad on the more expensive side but hats probably because of their location. Will continue to order when in need of a quick indian fix but if I can wait there's another place nearby I would order from.
author: Mercedes G.

description:
I'm really starting to like this place even though I had not been tempted to try it when it was called Bombay for years. The first time was about four months back when it was fairly empty, and I had stumbled on it when I noticed I'd be waiting quite a while for the next F-Line streetcar eastward. The server was most attentive and served complimentary Papadum with three savory-to-sweet dipping sauces (photo: http://bit.ly/29hKvzi). I noticed above me was a flat-screen TV, and an elaborate Bollywood movie musical production was being shown. Even though I'm sure most customers would want to see a Giants game, I rather enjoyed this atmospheric touch since they were just showing dance ensemble numbers and not entire films.

For a starter, I went for the $4.95 Cucumber Tomato Salad which was simply slices of cucumber and tomato on a plate (photo: http://bit.ly/29rqB7G). It was fresh so I didn't mind the simplicity of it. My main dish was the $13.95 Lamb Shank, a huge portion of meat falling right off the bone since it had been braised for 24 hours, and it was sitting in a pool of their onion-tomato cream sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/29hKsDM). Delicious comfort food accompanied by a $1.95 serving of Basmati Rice (photo: http://bit.ly/29khFBm). It was all served quite efficiently with just enough time for me to catch the F. Months later, and it was PRIDE Saturday with the Castro especially crowded with revelers. I suggested Tara to Jamie W. thinking it might not be as crowded as other spots. I was wrong.

But fortunately for us, one table for two opened up quickly, and it was the same table I dined at the first time, and another glitzy Bollywood musical number was playing on the flat-screen. This time we tried the $13.95 Coconut Lamb Curry which chunks of the same lamb shank and had them swimming in a luxuriant coconut curry sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/29Iu11G). Basmati Rice was needed, of course, and we complemented the lamb with the $10.95 Bhindi Masala, frankly a much fresher take on the braised okra dish in onion-tomato gravy (photo:  http://bit.ly/29dM9z4). there was so much saucy goodness on he table we ordered the $2.95 Garlic Naan, plenty enough for the requisite sopping (photo: http://bit.ly/29oXpfI). Our server was the same as the first visit, and he was just as attentive even in a crowded house.

FOOD - 4 stars...really tasty lamb dishes and a fresh bhindi masala moves this one up the ranks of Indian spots in the city
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...a bit dark with the requisite Rajastani touches
SERVICE - 4 stars...this young server's enthusiasm goes unabated
TOTAL - 4 stars...the Castro finally has a solid Indian spot at last
author: Ed U.

description: What an awesome place with amazing food. I will come back again. I felt like they treated me as if they would have wanted to be treated as a guest.
author: Diane F.

description: My go to when I want Indian Cuisine in my neighborhood for delivery. It good to try the two person menu it gives you a choice of everything good to try, order your extra nan breads.
author: RICHARD J.

description:
Tara is a cozy and welcoming Indian restaurant on Market near the Castro. This has become is my favorite Indian restaurant in San Francisco. The service is impeccable, and the food is amazing. 

Not only is the menu extensive, but the food is also consistently excellent. The portions are just right, as is the presentation. This is very much upscale fare at a very reasonable price. 

Tara feels very comfortable, a place where you can enjoy a good meal with friends and family. Do check it out if you get a chance!
author: Erik H.

description: Ordered delivery from here the other night and overall I had a good experience. Ordered the garlic naan, the spinach stuffed naan, the chicken tikka masala, and the lamb saag. When it arrived it was a tiny bit cool, but since it was delivery I didn't hold this against them. The chicken tikka masala and the lamb saag were both good, but if I had to choose I would say the lamb saag was slightly better. I ordered them both mild simply because this was the default setting and I will say there was no kick to them at all so if you want some spice make sure you switch from the default setting. My least favorite thing about the order was probably the garlic naan. I really could not taste a difference between regular naan and the garlic naan. Other than this it was all very good and I would probably order from here again.
author: Alissa T.

description:
I typically only have Indian food when I'm hung over. This time the roommate was the one craving it. (Minus the hangover, that is.) We ordered lunch on Sunday, April 3rd through Postmates since we had a $10 off coupon code. The roomie placed the order around 12:50pm and it arrived around 1:50pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

Prices below are what's listed on Postmates. Not sure what the actual prices were as we did not get an itemized receipt.

*Samosa: potato and peas stuffed indian pastry, mint and tamarind chutney ($4.95)
*Chicken tikka masala dish: chicken breast, and tomato-cashew gravy ($12.95)
*Butter chicken masala dish: tandoori cooked chicken leg, and tomato-cashew gravy ($12.95)
*Chicken vindaloo dish: chicken, vinegar, potato and spicy sauce ($11.95)
*Garlic naan ($2.95)
*Serrano chili naan ($2.95)
*Chicken naan ($3.95)
*Onion kulcha: red onion, cilantro and chat masala ($3.95)
*Chicken biryani: aromatic chicken, basmati rice, saffron, mint and egg ($12.95)

I loved the curries here! I'm not normally a fan of vindaloo, but it was savory and spicy. Great flavor! The butter chicken and tikka masala were also delicious! We asked for both spicy and they had a nice heat. The tikka masala more so than the butter chicken. Both also had a good amount of meat. I like my curries thick so I enjoyed the butter chicken more as the tikka masala was a little thin and watery. The samosas were also very tasty. Crispy on the outside and soft inside.

I'm not normally a fan of biryani and this one didn't change my mind. Kind of mushy and the cardamom seeds were a little much when accidentally consumed with the rice. The roommate picked them all out before eating the rest of the dish. The most disappointing items for me were the naan. All had great flavor, but the textures were a little too doughy. I wish they were softer with a nice chew, instead of being a little tough.

Amazing curries and samosas. I only wish the naan was just as good.
author: Elena N.

description:
I've been here three times and the food has been incredible every time. I've probably eaten at 50 different Indian restaurants and have never liked any as much as this one. 

Garlic naan, kabuli naan, chicken momos, lamb korma, lamb paneer, saag paneer. All great.

Once the restaurant was empty when we arrived at 6 and on a Saturday it was empty for the entire noon hour. So confusing. Why does everything in SF have lines except this place?
author: John K.

description:
Ordered: Shrimp Tikka Masala, Mango Lassi and Garlic Naan. 
Got little burned and dried garlic naan, but really liked Shrimp Tikka Masala. Chose the most spicy level and it was spicy as ordered and the taste was very good, not disappointing! And Mango Lassi was good, too.
author: P K.

description: Really fricking good indian food.
author: Will C.

description:
Dinner review.

Chicken tikka masala - 2/5
Butter chicken tikka masala - 4/5 - This one has thigh meat. Much better than breast.
Lamb vindaloo - 3/5
Lamb shank - 2/5 - Overcooked

Overall, decent Indian delivery option. "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description: The food is not good. The bread is dry and tasteless. Honestly was a waste of 40 dollars. Will not be returning. The deliver driver was nice, though.
author: Anthony P.

description: I was brought here for the first time. I am not new to Indian cuisine but this place definitely blew me away. Everything was delicious. The one that really stood out to me was the Vegetarian Momo. Never had nor heard it before. I believe it is Nepalese rather than Indian and really loved it and I'm not even vegetarian. Like I always say, be adventurous and try something you've never had.
author: John A.

description: Found this place on Yelp, so glad we did. The atmosphere was great and food was amazing. I only wish we lived here so we could come back.  Great service and huge portions! Yum
author: TinaMarie B.

description:
Fantastic. They have only improved in the two years since I moved in nearby, and this restaurant now astounds with every order. 
The biryani and garlic naan is my go-to, a literally perfect meal to me. The lamb biryani I ordered today is so flavorful, even better than last time, and I have literally been more and more impressed every time i order. For instance I used to find whole spices, such as cloves and bay leaves, inside of the rice. Now, there is only a flavorful and substantial serving of pure, edible, healthy goodness in my biryani. It wasnt much to complain about in the first place, spices come with the territory, but yet they have continued to improve. Their deserts are fantastic, by the way, though I always order a Kabuli na'an for desert and it's simply delectable. 
This is the best Indian cuisine in San Francisco during the in between hours of 3pm-5pm, hands down, I feel like they are there for me when other nice places are closed. Thank you all at Tara!
author: Trevor L.

description:
Wow, this is not your typical Indian cuisine. Their style of food is a refreshing blend that I find unfamiliar yet attractive. A complementary plate of very delicate Sun Dried Lentil Wafers/Papadum was placed on our table as friendly servers helped us with our menu selections.

At $2.95 their Garlic Naan and the $3.95 Onion Kulcha were inexpensive and met our expectations. At $8.95 the Chicken Momos with Himalayan spices were juicy and plentiful.

The $12.95 Coconut Chicken Curry was yummy and, at $13.95 the Coconut Lamb Curry still had that wonderful essence of lamb in a similarly delicious base of coconut milk, tomato and onion.

We concluded with the $2.00 Masala Chai, a bit sweet and two deserts.  The $3.95 Gulab Jamun which were donut-like balls touched with light syrup and their $3.95 Mango Kulfi, which is similar to ice cream yet much lighter, both were uniquely different.
author: Caesar A.

description:
Hooray for the new restaurant on the block! All the waiters that work here are overly eager, which already tells me that I'll be in good hands throughout my meal. With freshly-cut roses, Bollywood music videos playing on the TV, and Indian art on the walls, the ambiance was set. This is the perfect date place.

Our meal started with complimentary papadum with three dipping sauces. All of them were delicious. We also had Flying Horse beer which is perfectly light and will not overpower the flavor of your food. Naturally we ordered samosas for our appetizer which were so good, especially with the dipping sauces that came with the padadum. Instantly, I relived the time when I tried to make samosas but failed miserably.

For our entree, we got the lamb rogan josh and chicken vindaloo. Even though we ordered "medium spicy" the curries came out mild. Otherwise, they were not bad. Went well with the basmati rice and garlic naan that we also ordered. The garlic naan is amazing, by the way. This was not the best Indian curry I've had, but I get the feeling that this food will get better in the coming months. Still quite delicious. Part of me wishes I had ordered some kheer to end the meal on a sweet note, but I'll have to come back to try that.

There's always a handful of places in each city that I'll always take guests to. Tara Indian Cuisine just became one of them! Thank you all the staff members here for working so hard!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Quick delivery and Good menu selection but food didn't seem to have much flavor. Wasn't spicy enough and we ordered it medium spice. Usually that's enough to make you sweat.
author: Evan S.

description: We went for dinner late Friday night. The food was excellent (we had lamb shank and salmon saag) and the garlic naan was delicious. Also nice was that the restaurant was not loud (unlike so many restaurants in SF...) so we could actually enjoy a nice romantic dinner without having to scream at each other in order to be heard!). We will definitely be back.
author: Katya F.

description: I live this place. I normally come for lunch and ask for the lunch vegetarian meal. The best Mango Lace
author: Kecya Felix D.

description:
Probably the best Indian food I've had in San Francisco... other than perhaps Dosa, which is a bit more expensive.

Definitely worth checking out. All the traditional dishes, exquisitely prepared, in a nice comfortable atmosphere in a great neighborhood.
author: Sean B.

description:
I was here in a group of five without a reservation, but we were immediately seated. The restaurant was half empty. Being in San Francisco, it worries me when a restaurant isn't fully or at least 80% seated during peak dining hours. But to my surprise, the food was pretty good. We ordered a few curry dishes and lots of naans. My favorite was the Kabuli Naan, which had shredded coconut, raisins and cashews.

the Ambiance
dim lighting & low noise level, good place for a good conversation... Sort of wished they had more TVs on their walls, I am a fan of Indian music videos!

the Parking
Street parking only, but I was able to find a spot within the same block. My friends parked 2 blocks away.
author: Tony W.

description: Amazing food. The curry and the naan bread just melt in your mouth. Definitely will be back
author: Luis M.

description: Great! Ordered delivery. Everything was tasty, and hot. Friends said that there medium spicy orders packed some heat, but were delicious.
author: stoke k.

description: Yummy. I need to try more things on the menu.  Friendly waiters. Easy vibe. I'll be back.
author: T B.

description: The food is so good! This is a staple weekly for my husband and me. I usually order the butter chicken, coconut lamb, and garlic naan but when I ask for recommendations Tara does not disappoint! YUMMMMMY
author: Audrey T.

description:
This place is sooo yummy. Ordered delivery a few times. It's inexpensive and delicious! Delivery arrived quickly. I ordered the chicken tikka Masala, garlic naan and butter naan, basmati rice and a mango lassi. 

Currently waiting on my next delivery ..

Only $20.00 for all this great food, call me a repeat customer !!
author: Francesca D.

description:
I've been walking by this restaurant for years. I went in last week and I was extremely impressed. The food was absolutely delicious. The wait staff were attentive and polite.
I am a huge fan now. I plan on eating here several times a week. I can't wait to start introducing Tara to my friends.
Thank you Tara.
author: Brian H.

description: Super good Indian restaurant in the Castro.  We ordered a lot as we wanted to try a lot, but that's okay as you can always take home.  Curry the day after is better anyway, right?  We had the chicken tikka masala, lamb curry, butter chicken, tandoori chicken, salmon curry, butter naan, garlic naan, and momos to start.  No, we were not feeding a village.  We did take home enough for probably a couple of meals though.  Everything was really good.  Favorites were the lamb as it was tender and tasty and the chicken tikka masala as it had just the right amount of yogurt flavor.  Service was excellent and friendly.  So good.
author: Ronny T.

description:
Inexpensive but good food. I was confused by some of the earlier reviews that praised the buffet - they don't have a buffet now. They do however, have a lunch special (vegetarian or non-vegetarian) which comes with 3 dishes and a naan plus rice (no dessert). 

The food was good, the service was decent and the place is clean and efficient. Great value for money
author: Sudeep K.

description: The service here was great. The interior is charming and aesthetic for pictures. The food was good and there are quite a selection of vegan and vegetarian food too. The menus are organized so you can easily find what you want if you want chicken, lamb, seafood, or veggie dishes. I prefer my food with the butter naan instead of rice. I'm glad I found this restaurant. It's very fancy looking, has delicious food, great service, but isn't expensive at all.
author: Apolline B.

description:
Friendly service and incredible food.

We had salmon tikka masala, chicken biryani, and Kadai paneer with garlic naan.

Everything was incredibly fresh and had wonderful flavors.

I definitely recommend this place and look forward to going back.
author: Thomas K.

description: This place has such good food! I'm a vegetarian and there's a lot of options here. The paneer tikka kebab is my favorite! It comes out on a sizzling plate with so much flavor and is super filling. It's a must try if you like paneer or tandoori.
author: Lauren W.

description: Pleasantly surprised how good this place was since the last Indian restaurant in the space wasn't so good. They brighten the place up and decorated it which made the atmosphere tons better. Food was very good- well prepared and flavorful. We ordered Chicken korma, eggplant dish and lamb kabobs and paneer naan and loved everything. The portions were just right too. Only negative was the kitchen took a long time to cook the food- we waited probably 30 min before food came. Service was very friendly. A nice new addition to the neighborhood.
author: Puff G.

description:
I tried Tara's chicken tikka masala, and I would describe it as "meh." The sauce was kind of watery, and it just wasn't as flavorful as at other Indian places I've tried in SF.

On the plus side, they're open a bit later than other places in the neighborhood, so I might order delivery from them again in a pinch. Otherwise, if it's chicken tikka masala you're after, there are better options.
author: Jeff W.

description: Love this place! The food is so good and the delivery is always fast! I wish I can afford to order every night!
author: Alyssa I.

description:
Always order delivery from these guys and haven't changed our order since we landed on what we love. Chicken tikka masala is always great, their lamb vindaloo is super spicy but so great (we always order hot), vegetarian biriyani is just the right mix of rice and veggies and the paneer naan is great. 

This will literally get order every other week in my house. No questions asked.

One day hopefully we'll eat there in person. One of the best regular indian restaurants in the city.
author: Paul W.

description: The food here is very good, but the delivery guy is so rude. The two times I've gotten delivery, despite tipping 20% ahead of time, the delivery guy refuses to come to the door and calls me to come to his car. Tonight I ordered and he seemed exceptionally irritated. He told us to not order at Tara anymore and order from a different restaurant called Royal Indian because it will be easier for them to deliver. So confusing and definitely put a damper on the meal.
author: Samantha K.

description:
Ordered online. Soup was very small and had little pieces of metal in it. Really dangerous. 

The Tandoori naan was so fluffy. I doubt is was baked in a tandoori. Usually one side should be crispy. 

The Malai Kofta was very salty.
author: Ziv Z.

description: My one and only highlight of the meal were the veg. momos which I found tasted great. The samosas were good but the entree I thought was just ok. Ambiance was quite nice though and servers were super nice and knowledgeable about the menu. Was happy to see the items on the menu easily identified when vegan. However,  if you are  vegan make sure the kitchen knows 'cos a dish we ordered supposedly vegan, came out with cream in it. Anyway, I don't think I would go for a 2 visit unless I was craving momos...
author: Anna P.

description:
I am a big fan of Tara. I order this online quite a bit. If you want really delicious Indian cuisine, my vote goes to this restaurant.

Usual order:

-Chicken tikka masala: it's creamy and the chicken is well-cooked. Yums.
-Garlic naan: a lot of flavor, especially for you garlic-lovers! 
-Kheer: who doesn't like rice pudding? This has a touch of "fragrance" in the flavor. Not sure how else to explain. The spices are nice - there we go.
-Mango sorbet: my fave dessert. It's refreshing with a lot of flavor.
author: S. C.

description:
Great authentic Indian food .
Wonderful flAvours and even better naan 
Love love love it
author: Feedback M.

description: Excellent food and service! This is our go to place for Indian food. Never disappoints.
author: L H.

description: Even better than expected. We had vegetarian dinner for two. Great value. Fresh and interesting Indian/Nepali. Very good service. We'd come back again!
author: Jow H.

description: Got it for delivery and it arrived in the estimated time, still warm, and good portions. Only complaint is that the food was really bland tasting. We got the chicken tikka masala, lamb vindaloo, tandoori chicken, mixed naan, and samosa. The food wasn't bad but it somehow just lacked flavor. Maybe it was an off night or something but I just don't feel it was as tasty as other places I've eaten at.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Hands down the best non fancy Indian food in San Francisco. Fresh authentic flavors, adequate portions, friendly service.

I ordered the below for pickup via Eat24 and could not have been happier.
Chicken Tikka Masala - good amount of chicken, not too sweet, excellent sauce
Saag Lamb - lamb tender and perfectly cooked, really nice smokey flavor
Okra - good, not my favorite
Garlic Naan - super good, HUGE!
Papadum for fun, loved eating this with their sweet chutney.

I scored rockstar parking for pickup, but I would say the main downside of this place is difficult parking in the area.

WINNER!
author: Josie M.

description:
We thought it was great, the best Indian food we've had in a long time. 

We had the scrumptious veg korma, delicious baigan bharta, a couple different breads, and rice. ALL great, as was the service, portion sizes, presentation, and decor.

We'll definitely return to enjoy future meals.
author: Veg V.

description: Great food. I've had my share of indian food all over the bay, and this is just all around very good, no complaints. also nice ambiance inside, and they were nice about us bringing our 6 month old in with us :)
author: Daco X.

description: My go-to when I crave Indian food. I live around the corner and tend to have them deliver - it's awesome. Their tandoori chicken is excellent.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: I've eaten a lot of delivery indian in SF and this is by far the tastiest.
author: Annie S.

description:
Tara
My fav-o-rite place for lunch  Buffet 
and Dinner
I always get the Momo's . delish 
The service is excellent
And the ambiance 
Wall Paintings
and fragrences wrap me up in a wonderful dining experience.

It's love in every bite 
Thanks  DüG
author: Dug D.

description: After spending almost 45 minutes trying to find a good restaurant in SF, we went with this based on the rating and it did not disappoint even a bit . Palak pakoras and mommos were really good . The order was too fast and I have never had such a big naan anywhere and just an assorted bread basket is good enough for a team of 5 easily. Head straight to Tara if you remain as confused as us that day and you will come out happy
author: Sindhuja S.

description:
Shhh...it's a secret that no one knows about.  But, this place has authentic Indian food and a banging lunch buffet on the cheap!  Just $11 for all-you-can-eat naan, curry, chicken tandoori, saag paneer, daal, pakora, and more. I was shocked by how empty the place was on a Sunday lunch because I thought the food was delicious and surprisingly affordable for San Francisco!  I will say that some of the buffet offerings were running a bit low when we got there, but I think that might be because they don't have a steady flow of customers yet.  But, after we got our first round, they were pretty good about replenishing the options.

When we sat down, we were asked if we wanted naan and they brought out fresh, piping hot naan that had been given a nice buttery coat.  It was just the perfect complement to all of the yummy curries and sauces from the dishes.  Everything was flavorful and savory, not too spicy, and very satisfying.  I had been craving Indian food for a while since I feel like it is difficult to find in the city so I am glad to finally have found a cheap gem!  I will most certainly be back!
author: Jess Y.

description:
Slow delivery, high price food 

At least 30$/each person 
For delivery, at least 2 hours waiting 

Suck restaurant, never gonna try again
author: Tongfei L.

description: Best Indian food I've had in the city...bar naan. ;) We ordered pick up, so I can't really speak to the atmosphere. Even my husband who doesn't typically love Indian food and finds it too heavy loved the food here. I got the chicken tekka masala and he got the salmon tandoori. Salmon came with lots of tasty veggies. Also highly recommend the garlic naan. Pro tip: you have to *order* rice, it does not come as a side.
author: Celie H.

description:
I think this might be the best (North) Indian cuisine in the general 'hood.  I'd put it head to head against any of them: Aslam's, Pakwan, Amber, you name it. The food is elegant without being pretentious, homestyle without being boring, and just flat-out brings the flavor with every dish.  They steal some influences from Nepalese cuisine which really distinguishes each dish without losing the principal elements.

Must-try's include the super savory chicken tikka masala and butter chicken (both have a subtle blend of cashew that sets it off), the creamy baigan bhartha (the best I've ever had in SF), their roasted garlic naan (the aroma will make your mouth water from a mile away), and their perfectly cooked jeera rice (saffron rice with a hint of cumin).

I'm glad they have delivery because as word gets out, I don't want to have to wait for a table.  This place is legit.
author: Saminda W.

description: Unfortunately they seem to have changed chefs as I noticed a decline in the food the past two weeks. The vegetable pakora was the hardest hit by this change. Food was excellent before and now it's still good but not amazing. Please bring back the old chef!
author: Sarah S.

description: Always been my favorite Indian restaurant to eat at! Always recommending the spot as the place to eat if you want some Indian food.
author: Bryan C.

description:
Very good food. Unlike Pakwan, I didn't feel like I was going to regret the meal halfway through. Genuinely yummy, not too heavy. Naan was hot and fresh. Actually, everything was hot and fresh.

Service was great. Friendly team. Responsive.

OK, and the big one: they keep their CANNED Diet Coke chilled, and they they serve it over ice. YES. When you serve warm Diet Coke over cold ice, it's instantly flat. And if you serve fountain soda, it just tastes like poo no matter what. This is the REAL DEAL. Chilled Diet Coke, the real thing from a can, served over ice. YOU'RE WELCOME.

It's not mind-blowing 5-stars because it's hip, trendy, expensive, and worth traveling across the city to visit. On the contrary, it's 5 stars because it's in the Castro, it's cheap, it's delicious, and for what it is, it's about is good as a neighborhood Indian joint gets.
author: Matt M.

description:
Really great delivery experience from here. 

The food arrives super fast (around 30 minutes, definitely faster than the 45-60 minute time that was quoted) and it was really hot and tasted like it has just been made. The $20 delivery minimum plus free delivery is super reasonable and all the food was packed really nicely- no potential leakage and easy to store any leftovers. 

I enjoyed the food as well. I got regular naan, paneer naan, and malai kofta (tomato based gravy with vegetable dumplings). Naan was soft and warm and delicious (and at $2 each, a great price too). The paneer naan was ok but not as good as I expected and I didn't find it to have more flavor than the plain naan. The kofta curry was tasty- I ordered it mild and I liked the level of spice in it. Could have maybe used just a dash more seasoning (not chili but maybe a pinch of salt or something). The kofta in it were good as well and I'm glad I ordered the kofta curry over paneer as I was debating between the two. The chutneys they gave with the food (tamarind and green) were tasty and complemented the food nicely. 

I don't tend to eat a lot of Indian food from restaurants but if I ever want to in the future, this is definitely an option I would keep in mind. 5 stars for their delivery experience and 4 for the food.
author: Seema U.

description: Everything was delicious but the baingan (eggplant) pakora was mind blowingly delicious. I still think about it sometimes at night.
author: Colleen R.

description: It's pretty good, affordable, and quick for takeaway. Sit down experience is a bit depressing as the lighting is dim and the atmosphere not particularly exciting. Very convenient location for the greater Castro!
author: Anees L.

description:
Best Indian food on the West-Side of SF. Fast delivery, under 30 minutes. The vegetable momo dumplings are delicious and enough for 2- 4 people. Never disappointed by any of these dishes and have tried the 

Navaratna Korma  
Baigan Bhartha   
Aloo Gobi  (never go wrong!)


Sooooo goood!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
We were visiting from Palm Springs and trying to decide on the type of cuisine that we wanted.  We started walking down Market St and came upon Tara Indian Cuisine.  This is a well staffed and friendly environment.

The owners were great!  

Started off with a couple of Taj Mahal beers.

We then ordered the Tandoori assorted (tandoori cooked chicken breast and lamb), the Lamb chops (Australian lamb chops, yogurt spice marinated, tandoori executed), the Coconut chicken curry (curry leaves, mustard, smooth coconut gravy) and of course Butter naan and Basmati rice.

For desert, we tried the Gulab jamun (deep fried milk dumplings with light syrup) and the Kheer (rice and milk pudding, raisin, cashew, coconut). 

The entire meal was very authentic and enjoyable.  We were not rushed and were very glad we stopped in.

We will definitely return the next time we are in San Fran!
author: Mike B.

description: I love this place! It's my go to Indian delivery spot. The Kabuli naan is awesome and I love their chicken vindaloo too! The food always gets to me pretty quickly too. Two thumbs up!!
author: Christine L.

description: I haven't been to Tara's physical location but I order delivery from here pretty frequently. Their curries and biryani are solid and reasonably priced. The Chicken Momo (Nepalese chicken dumplings) are really why I keep ordering from here. I love how delicately seasoned they are, and it's alarmingly easy to down an entire order of them.
author: Ryan D.

description: Love this place! Ordered the malai kofta. It's some of the best I ever had! I will always come here when I visit sf.
author: Chrissy F.

description: Great food, great service, reasonable price, great delivery, great pickup, great dancing shows on their tv, just go! Take out is fast and quality is controlled
author: Ramin A.

description: I've ordered food from here twice. The food is great and the deliveries quick, the delivery people are nice too. Get the garlic naan - it's the best I've ever had!
author: Bryce B.

description: Had a wonderful food today. I know being in food business very hard to please everyone. We were there for the lunch. Ordered their tandori chicken that came on sizzler very flavorful, samosas were and crispy and right amount of spice. Friendly and attentive customer service.we had gulab jamun which was juicy and very delicious. highly recommended,,, will be back soon. Thank you Tara for making our experience great.
author: Somnath R.

description: We ordered delivery from this place and I'm excited to have a reliable new spot for Indian food! We had the butter chicken, paneer tikka masala (same sauce as the butter chicken), saag paneer, and eggplant. Everything was tasty but relatively mild -- the food was missing the punch-in-your-face spice bomb that I love about rich Indian food. That said, I will definitely be ordering from Tara again!
author: Jean L.

description:
That flavor, man. Seriously, no other joint can compete. 

Baigan Bertha? 5 stars.

Saag paneer? 4 stars. Pakwan still wins on this one taste-wise, but Tara does make it a little less greasy (that's a win, if your lipid panel is ruling you).

The daal (with mustard)? 5 stars.

Garlic naan? 4 stars.

The thing that makes me bow down to this place, is that it's packed with flavor, like the kind you can only get from a home-cooked meal (someone's Grandma had the bomb recipes). But, hold on for this, it's not greasy! I'm hooked, this is our new go to spot for delicious Indian food. Seriously, these are the kinds of recipes that are passed on from generation to generation, and kept in the family. 

If you order on Eat24, they'll have your order ready stat, no items missing, tamarind sauce all up in your muggggggg.

Our 6-month-old is gonna get hooked up with this goodness regularly.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
I am a great lover of Indian food especially this place,"TARA INDIAN CUISINE ". Recently changed management offers the new menu along with the great new dishes cooked by the genuine and experienced chef.
     I was there last week with friends ,located exactly on the heart of city 15th and market ,great view.
     Chicken tikka masala - excellent
      Sag paneer- rich taste.
      Garlic and cheese nan- soft and flavorful .
     Momo- out of this world,,, should try.

Authentic Indian food,,, thank you Tara ,,, I'll come again,,,,
author: Feroz C.

description: From now on this place is gonna be my favourite for Takeout,Delivery and Dine-in from now on got delighted by their hospitality and the taste reminds me of utterly pure desi style which I forgot from pretty long time.....
author: Phani C.

description:
On a rainy weekend in SF downtown found this decent Indian restaurant. Great ambiance around with some decent portraits. Ordered an Non vegetarian lunch special for $9.99

Order came in like 10-12 mins(they make fresh bread for every order). It had two slices of Nan(Indian bread),3 curries(Lamb curry, Chicken tikka masala, Shai paneer), a bowl of rice and a desert kheer. Liked lamb curry it was boneless lamb cubes cooked with tomatoes and Indian spices. Overall its was a good lunch for 10 bucks. Might come back to try something else in there ever ending menu of Indian dishes.
author: Gopi K.

description: Ordered the popular chicken tikka masala and basmati rice to go and it was utterly disappointing. There were 5 chunks of 2-inch by 2-inch cubed meat that were dry as paper. The curry itself was okay, but for nearly 20 dollars on a to go meal, I got fleeced. Would never come here again for utterly terrible Indian food at premium prices.
author: Myles L.

description:
Decided to try this place due to the fair amount of positive reviews. Saturday night for dinner. The place was strangely empty. We ordered:

Appetizer: chicken 65
It was average. The chicken was decently moist. The sauce was a bit on the sour side

Naan: we ordered the chicken and lamb naan. The chicken naan was very very dry

Chicken tika masala and chicken tandoori: these dishes were the reasons this review was not a 1 star. Both were quite delicious.

Lamb shank: This dish was inedible. The meat was so hard and tough that we gave up trying to cut it with a steak knife. 

When asking for our check, we politely notified our waiter about the lamb dish. He proceeds to poke it a bit with a knife and saying "No. It's supposed to be like that." He comes back with our check and says, "I asked the chef and he says its normal." This was a blatant lie since he was in my line of sight the entire time. A simple apology would have done wonders. This is one place we definitely won't be coming back.

Our overall dining experience was poor. The long wait for our food coupled with extremely dissatisfactory service justifies this low review.
author: Ding M.

description: Really good! We ordered Chicken Tikka masala, Aloo Gobi and spinach pakor, all was very delicious!
author: Cas R.

description:
Ordered naan, okra and chicken tikka masala. Naan and okra were ok, but chicken tikka masala was awful - the chicken felt like it wasn't cooked properly and had a strange smell. Trashed it immediately. Will never order from this place again.

They refunded us for the chicken tikka masala when we brought this to their attention.
author: Rohit N.

description: Best Indian food I have tried in San Francisco. Being an Indian, my palate is not that easy to get satisfied coz I already knew how each style of Indian food tastes. But this is really awsome and I suggest to try atleast once or else u miss something good. Suggested to couple of my friends and they really loved the food. I will definitely come to this restaurent again and again. Coming to the food, Man!! you should try "Kashmiri chicken" the BEST curry I have ever eaten in restaurents. "Lamb shank", the meet was so tender that the knife cuts it smoothly. Will visit again.
author: Prudhvi Chowdary N.

description: So disappointed in this place. I was sick and was so excited to get takeout (a luxury I rarely indulge in) so I was bummed that this place wasn't great. It's not cheap, ended up being $40 for me and my mom and the portions were super tiny. I got a curry that was pretty much just potatoes with barely any curry, some stale naan, tiny samosas with mediocre dipping sauce that was super watery, and fried calamari that was way too greasy. The curry was supposed to be eggplant but I only counted like 5 and the rest was potato. The meal was overall way too starchy and not very flavorful. Definitely wouldn't eat here again super disappointed.
author: Sarah R.

description: It's hard finding decent Indian food in SF (especially when you are Indian), but I was pleasantly surprised by Tara! I live in the area and ordered takeout from here based on the recent reviews and it did not disappoint. "Spicy" actually resulted in a nice kick, and the garlic naan are priced very reasonably for such large pieces. I had the chicken aachari (it was amazing, but it's one of my favorite dishes anywhere) and also got the coconut chicken, which was really good-- reminded me of the curries you find in South India. I will definitely be ordering from here in the future, looking forward to trying their sag paneer and beingan bharta.
author: Sonia H.

description:
The best indian delivery I've found in the Mission. I'd have a hard time choosing between Tara and Pakwan, except Tara delivers!! Bye (Felicia) Caviar!

I always get the basic white girl order of CTM and garlic naan. Raita is clutch. 

My only neg: the delivery guys cannot navigate my building despite having been here an embarrassing amount of times.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Good Indian restaurant.
- Great location
- Clean and pleasant restaurant
- Great service
- Food is good, not great.
          I had a veggie tikka masala that was good.  Gobi Aloo was also good.  Benghan Bartha was poor -- like it came out of a can.  They should remove this from the menu or else greatly improve it. Chicken tandoori was a different taste that i'm used to, but was excellent.
          Overall it's a good Indian restaurant.  If you want far greater flavors, then there are three excellent choices, all in the tandoor-loin on Jones Street, Chutney, Shalimar, Red Chili.
author: John H.

description: I ordered the chicken vindaloo spicy and it did not disappoint. However, there were too many strips of ginger. Compared to other Indian places in SF, their regular rice has a lot less spices. The interior had a nice comforting ambiance.
author: James S.

description:
These guys are wonderful! 

A neighborhood favorite, their chicken tikka masala and butter chicken masala is to die for. We eat here probably two to three times a month, it's so delicious. 

They're also incredibly friendly and remember us every time we come in for takeout. One time when their kitchen was under construction, they made food at their other location and brought it over for takeout! 

Can't recommend them enough. So great!
author: Mike I.

description: I love the new owner defiantly changed the menu it's SOOOOOO MUCH BETTER LOVE IT. U have to try it.
author: Ely Y.

description:
I love this place for delivery. Have eaten there once in house, and had a great time as well. They were showing Bollywood dance sequences that were wildly entertaining. Nice staff, too.

Don't miss the chicken 65 or the lamb rogan josh! solid every time.
author: Mister H.

description: This is my comfort food and it was very good.  We ordered the spinach with cottage cheese and the lentil.  I was disappointed that the Naan couldn't be ordered without the cherries.
author: Julie H.

description: I ordered from here on a whim because my usual Indian place wasn't open, And I ended up LOVING it! Such good food, amazing flavor, and KIND people. Delivery is always so quick and the guy is so sweet, smiling and such a trooper having to walk up 2 flights of stairs in my apartment complex. You guys rock! Thank you!
author: S B.

description:
DELISH! Everything we ordered was wonderful and delivery ON SCHEDULE.
ENJOY!
author: janet k.

description:
Ordered on eat24. Food came in a timely fashion. 

Saag panner -WAY too spicy for "mild" 

Paneer tikka masala - bland and no spice at all for "medium" 

Veggie pakota- mushy and wet by the time they arrived. 

Rice - undercooked

Thoroughly underwhelmed, only stars are for the last time we ate there and the food was good. 

Please work on your delivery standards.
author: Cara M.

description: I went with my friends for dinner here. The ambience and service were good. The food, however was really bad. I had egg friend rice and my friends had chicken biryani and Naan. The Naan with gravy was decent but the rice items were bland with no taste. It was a big let down for us.
author: Ramkishore S.

description:
Yelped to add another good Indian restaurant at SF to our to-go list, and ended up at this small hidden gem of a place.

Food menu has a lot of Indian options ( both veg and non-veg), and so does the Bar menu!. The prices are very fair, looking at the quantity of the dishes. The tandoori chicken was well tendered, and the kadhai panner was sumptuous. The naans were huge and well crafted. Deserves and extra star for the complimentary 'paapads' with drinks ;)

The place is very homely, and the staff ultra-friendly and welcoming. They even gave away some food to a homeless guy who wandered in. Loved the gesture!

 I believe there's a buffet available for lunch, not sure though. But definitely, a must-go, if you are looking out for some good Indian cuisine.
author: Aditya N.

description:
We ordered chicken korma, shrimp curry and braised lamb shank. Chicken korma and shrimp were pretty good (4/5); however, the most anticipated dish--lamb shank was a disaster. I had to ask for a steak knife to cut the meat off the bone. By definition, braised lamb should be slow cooked carefully such that the meat melts off the bone with a spoon. When I mentioned, the excuse was that probably its cuz it was cooked in a large quantity--that is understandable for a mid tier indian restaurant, but still not making sure the quality is a total blow.

Other than that the ambiance is nice and conveniently located near the market. I might go there once in a while, but unless their quality is consistent I would just say that there are better options.
author: Tarik M.

description:
I tried tara for the first time today, and i must say, it was delicious! I went for the lunch buffet around 2pm, and found all of the dishes i tried (chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, salad, basmati rice, tandoori chicken, onion fitter things, and naan) to be very fresh, well flavored, and warm. Even the quality of the naan suggested they make it from scratch inside the house. The staff were very kind and enthusiastic, and i liked the traditional ambiance of hand painted indian imagery on the walls and the impressive Bollywood dance numbers playing on the tv. Lastly, the fresh roses on each table and the very clean restaurant were small details that show the owners and staff take much pride in the restaurant and their customers. I really appreciated that attention to detail.

Will be back!
author: Leslie B.

description: I came here for lunch on Sunday, and they didn't have the buffet!  They discontinued it.  I was so disappointed.  I had the chicken tiki masala...sauce was great but chicken tasted like rubber.  I don't think they simmered it long enough so it would be tender.  Their naan was like flat crackers.   But the momo was good!  I liked it better when it was under the old ownership..was it called Star India?
author: J W.

description: I wish i had not ordered food from this restaurant. Not sure if you guys know how to make veg biryani. Not ordering food again. Just wasted 21$.
author: Manju S.

description: Underrated Indian in "upper Safeway heights" with an excellent, tasty buffet.  I like the saag dishes and the properly cooked daal.  Moderate heat levels.
author: David S.

description:
Nope. No way. Skip - there are too many half decent Indian restaurants around to take the risk. 

Good: lamb both starter was soft, moist and flavorful 

Okay: chicken starter - flavorful and again moist but boneless would have been better. 

Bad: daal and alloo matter. Could have been fine but made it sweet. Similarly the bread (missi roti and chappati) soggy but in fairness to them delivery is always hard for bread. 

Awful: chicken tikka masala. Ugh. Weird orange color, sweet creamy sauce. I don't know what it is and I'm Indian. Unfortunately I don't think it knew what it was meant to be either. Felt sorry for the chicken pieces which were good. 

Desert was average. 

Delivery was long - an hour and twenty but that's ok given it was a Saturday night.
author: Rajash S.

description: The food is delicious with all the traditional dishes offered. The chiken vindaloo was the group favorite as was the khadi ghost. Also the prices were not bad. Good food good service and good prices in a good location.
author: Carter M.

description:
Great curry house! I am from the UK and have been searching San Francisco for a great English-style Ruby Murray. Now I have found it!

Staff are slightly over keen but I find that only adds to a traditional experience.

10/10

P.s. Try the Kabaui Nan, you won't be disappointed.
author: Alby B.

description:
I came here with my Godmother two weeks ago, and we came back a week later. I must say, this place is super delicious. We have ordered chicken tikka masala, lamb shank, white rice, Indian chai tea, and dessert. All the food we ordered was so fresh and piping hot when it got to our table. The nun was slightly crunchy in texture and fresh out of the oven. I couldn't say enough good things about this place. I am a big time foodie and incredibly picky. I value the quality of the food, seasoning, freshness, as well as service - an absolute must for me and my family is hot food when it gets to my table, and this place certainly delivered on that and exceeded my expectations. 

The owner was incredibly kind, attentive, and super nice. His level of service was impeccable. Even on a busy night, he attended to us with so much care that this has become our new favorite Indian Restaurant in San Francisco. You get both great tasting food and exceptional service - what more can anyone ask for? Needless to say, I am very delighted with this place and I can't wait for another great dining experience at Tara Indian Cuisine. 

It's totally worth a try. You won't be disappointed :-).
author: Indira S.

description: I make a phone order here.My food arrived that was really really authentic spicy and delicious.Can't even say in words.The best food I have ever had.Remembered INDIA.
author: Attipatla A.

description: Everything tasted watered down. We ordered samosas, basmati rice, chicken curry, tanduri rotti. The iced tea was so watered down it actually tasted just like ice water. the curry tasted like it was also watered down. I've been to many Indian restaurants and I don't know why this place is 4 stars. Seats were crowded, no space to walk. We barely got any attention and the place was empty too. Servers are always standing by the bar and you have to call them for them to serve you...
author: Shirly C.

description:
We ordered takeout - chicken tikka masala, roasted eggplant and garlic naan. The garlic naan is huge and can certainly be shared amongst 2 people, but not really 3. 

The chicken tikka masala was unique - the sauce was a lot creamier than I was used to, which made me like it more! I also highly recommend the roasted eggplant - so delicious!
author: Amy Y.

description: Nice ambiance, food n service. Would love to come back again and again. The food is flavorful and delicious. I like the chicken 65, chilli chicken n the mango lassi.
author: Bon Vivant R.

description:
What an unexpected find tonight in the Castro! I took my mum here and we had the most delicious meal. Service was perfect and we felt really welcome. 
Get the Indian tea- a lovely creamy chai- very authentic. 
We had the chicken tikka masala, vegetable curry (really excellent) and saag aloo (EXCELLENT!!) 
I'll definitely be returning :)
author: Emily C.

description: Solid good Indian food. A little pricey, but free papadam. Clean and good attentive service. Good for a leisurely group dinner.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I have been here twice now and both the times the food tasted so different as if they changed chefs. There is no consistency in food taste. The buffet has enough for both meat eaters and vegetarians. I like their Onion Pakoras, chutneys, Saag Paneer and Kheer. 

$10.99 buffet
author: Hiral P.

description: What a surprise gem!!  I unexpectedly couldn't get out to lunch w a friend who had come over. So, I hurriedly ordered delivery from here---simply because it came up in the very beginning of my yelp thread (nice placement). But, as it turned out, those 4.5 stars meant business!! Food came faster than I had expected. The delivery person was courteous and professional.  Food was hot and well-prepared & well-packaged. The spice level was spot on!  When I indicated spicy, it was definitely spicy! Medium was a solid medium.  The samosas were delicious---crunchy on the outside with a hot and full filling on the inside. The lamb saag was nicely made w good sized chunks of nice lamb cuts.  We'll definitely order from here again!
author: Chibimaru L.

description:
I returned to this restaurant with some friends after hearing they had changed hands.  The change was immediately obvious upon entering.  The setting was light, airy and serene.  The staff greeted us with courtesy and respect as if we had been visiting maharajahs.  The luncheon menu was delicious.  Most of us had the buffet and it was composed of an excellent array of choices.  

Our waiter was most attentive and helpful, he explained the various dishes and made recommendations.  His guidance was of immeasurable help.  Thank you Rajit.  

It made such an impression that we returned the following week.  Not sure if they have bicycle parking, but we were able to stable our elephant as we dined.  A welcome addition to the Castro and San Francisco.
author: James H.

description: Great Indian food. Its a hidden gem that not many know about. The food truly feels like homemade Indian food. If you're in the area definitely check it out. The Thali,Shahi Paneer, aloo matter, and tikka masala are a must try.
author: Sai M.

description: I went for buffet. Pakora was oily, raita was not fresh, curry & rice were okay, saag paneer was the only delicious dish. Ambiance was average, low light, there was no enough light on my plate! Taking away 1 star for food and 1 for ambiance.
author: Maulik S.

description:
I can't praise enough this place, everything is perfect! 
High quality and tasty food in reasonable prices and excellent service.
author: Eirini P.

description: Worst Tikka Masala I have had in the city.  It was not flavorful, so bland and zero spice to it.
author: Kara S.

description: It's no surprise Tara has almost 5 stars overall - some of the best Indian food I've ever eaten and particularly the best in San Francisco right now, along with incredibly friendly staff and quick delivery. Cannot be beat! I highly recommend the korma! And the atmosphere at the restaurant is delightful as well, with warm ambience and lighting and a muted but colorful Bollywood film playing on the screen in the back. Just delightful in all ways.
author: Emmabelle S.

description:
Beyond the magic. Fantastic dinner with a class service. The momo just melted in mouth. The chicken tikki masala is prepred in real authentic way - creamy, rich and perfect amount of texture of spices. 
I heard about chef Arun alot ; in real he is just too good.
Keep it up your venture and enthusiasm in the neighborhood. Castro district and Noe valley should be lucky to have another choice of indo Himalayan flavor.
author: Laxman A.

description: The food is delicious and the service is outstanding! We came here a on late Sunday night and were the last party when we left the restaurant. Our party of 7 ordered the following: Chicken 65, Samosas, naan, Tandoori Chicken, Chicken Tikka Masala, Kashmiri Chicken, Saag Paneer, and Lamb Biryani. The food came fresh to the table and everyone was very pleased. I especially loved their the Chicken 65 and the Kashmiri Chicken. Those were quite tasty. Their service is extremely attentive and was a nice change from other Indian restaurants I've been to.
author: Lisa R.

description:
The place is lovely and the location is in the hoppin Market Street area.  

Service was good and the food (samosa, chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, saag aloo and naan) were some of the best I have had.
author: T C.

description: How wonderful to have amazing Indian food a phone call away. During business trips to SF we rent a house so our team can stay together. Everyone was very pleased with the meal. We are in the gourmet food industry and appreciate being able to eat at "home" while still having a delicious dinner in our pjs...
author: Aaron W.

description: The best Indian food that I ever had! I traveled in India and was looking for long time for a good Indian food that will be close to the original. This place is amazing and the service is great! Also the price are very reasonable. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!
author: Zohar M.

description:
No longer does lunch buffet
Still on posted menu
FYI
Went in for seating and they told us they no longer do buffet but have been too busy to update physical posted menu at door
Pretty sure this falls under California truth in advertising retail but they simply do not seem to care.
author: Mark K.

description: Ordered the seasonal vegetable vegan coconut based curry, the chicken tika masala, garlic naan, papadom and mango chutney. All of the food was delicious, service was friendly and polite and quick. The atmosphere is warm, decor is very nice. We came on our way out of San Francisco, but I would recommend for a date night as well.
author: Giorgi A.

description: Standard Northern Indian food without much flavor or flair. Ordered a variety of dishes and each one was fairly bland. Samosas seemed like they'd been sitting around and paneer was unimpressive. Live nearby and love me some Indian so wanted badly for this to impress but with the typical high price point for a complete meal I can't bring myself to try again.
author: Daniel E.

description: Got the lunch buffet. A good deal at $11, but pretty mediocre Indian food. Would like to see more vegetarian options and a friendlier staff! No vegan options in the buffet FYI.
author: Sheel M.

description:
This is one of the best indian restaurant i have found in San Francisco.The meal comes with complimentary papadum appetizers with a red and green chutney. I have been there 3 times already and every time i had an amazing experience, food was really good. There is not much oil in the food as i would get in other indian restaurants when i order curries.
Service is always great, servers are very attentive and fast service.
author: Sub N.

description: Wonderful service, best papadum I've ever had. Open late! Chicken Tikka Masala was perfectly spiced as was Saag Aloo and Aloo Gobi. Will be coming back when I'm in town!!!
author: Stephanie A.

description: I loved this place! The eggplant fritters were amazing! The garlic naan made my mouth water. And the service is delightful.
author: Erik W.

description: Best indian food I've had in a while. Had the chicken korma, chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, garlic naan, and fried egg rice. Ordered takeout from here too - everything was perfect. Will definitely be ordering/eating here again.
author: Ashley F.

description: I get delivery from Tara and always get the chicken tikka masala which is amazing and there always so nice on the phone!!
author: Linda M.

description: I hate complaining.. to the point I never do.. but this got even me upset.. I ordered food for delivery.. it came 1 hour and 20min later.. food was cold (Luke warm) and chicken was under cooked (raw still).. usually when I order from here it's great.. this was pretty bad though.. hopefully my chicken is done in the oven now and I can eat..
author: Austin A.

description: Eh maybe I got unlucky, but I've never been more disappointed with a serving of butter chicken. A decent garlic naan is what gets me up two stars, but man that was a letdown. I ordered butter chicken, garlic naan, and veggie pakoras for delivery and none was great. The chicken just didn't taste like butter chicken and was astonishingly bland. Naan was okay as I said, but the pakoras were overwhelmingly salty. Not sure I'll order from here again.
author: Nikhil S.

description:
I ordered take out on a weekday. 
Lamb Korma was tasty, so were the poppadams, though I'd hoped for a larger serving. 
The raita was okay, and the kheer/rice pudding was disappointing-- very thin, no nuts or raisins, overly sweet with no spices. 
For the price, I'd stick with the basics next time or look elsewhere.
author: H. K.

description: This was one of the best Indian meals I ever had. We tried the delicious Samosas for our appetizers. The Tandoori chicken and Chicken Tikka masala were amazing. We chose the rice cumin and turmeric and it was really good! They also have a variety of Naans. The garlic and Serrano were really good. Our servers were both very polite and attentive. We'll definitely come back!
author: Ladan E.

description:
Enjoyed a fun late dinner at the Tara recently. This restaurant was an accidental find with my friends as we were walking down Market Street, but I'm glad we stopped in. 

For dinner, we ordered the delicious lamb shank and coconut chicken curry severed with fresh rice. The food was amazing! Tried the chicken tikka masala, momo and veggie korma. The momo just melted in mouth. The chicken tikki masala was excellent, prepared in real authentic way .

The tables were prepared with clean white table clothes and adorned with fresh roses to set the mood. The service was excellent! The staff are friendly and made every effort to ensure their guest are happy. 

I will definitely come back here. Can't wait to bring my friends back!
author: Pablo R.

description: Gotten to go numerous times- good veggie options and husband said their tikka masala is best he has ever had. Great food and our last order took 18 minutes from online to door which is insane! I don't know how they did it and yes we are in walking distance but I haven't gotten food that fast at sit down restaurant before.
author: Isabel R.

description: No lunch buffet. Dang!  This place was completely empty. Have a buffet with lots of variety and make more dinero!
author: Cameron C.

description: Delicious food, great location, friendly service, reasonable prices, and not overly crowded
author: Sam K.

description: Ordered takeout and everything in the bag was delicious! Especially that spicy eggplant dish and they made sure to Saran Wrap my tea so I wouldn't spill it  will most definitely go back here again
author: Carly C.

description: Food tasted okay. However, delivery took over an hour and a half, so don't order here if you are any sort of hungry - they'll forget your order and pretend that "the driver was new" and "he'll be there in 5 minutes" after you call. Also, the chicken curry dishes we ordered had many small bones within the meat - not something you expect or want in this type of food. Would not recommend.
author: Edgar W.

description: Best Indian/Nepali food that we've had in San Francisco and at prices that are low for the area. Staff are gracious and invested in ensuring that each patron enjoys his or her meal.  Subtle mix of flavorings in a variety of dishes.  Chicken Momo appetizer is particularly good.
author: Steve B.

description: Delicious. My only complaint is that it was so good that I ate too much. I got the tikka masala, saag paneer, rice and garlic naan. I ordered from EAT24 and delivery was timely.
author: Cameron J.
