description: Food was delicately spiced and arrived hot and within forty minutes. The portions wet fair sized and made a great dinner. The rice wasn't overly seasoned with aromatics as so often happens. Their nan was of the lightest and had a wonderful texture perfect for eating my meal.
author: Gregory F.

description: We ordered delivery from Tara a couple of weeks ago. Our order arrived promptly, all items were present and accounted for, and everything was fresh, bursting with flavor, and yummy .... in short, delicious! Thank you, yelp reviewers, for leading us to such a great find! Highly recommend!
author: E. G.

description: If anyone knows a better place for Indian food, please share, because the food we had was so delicious. This is our favorite Indian restaurant in the city. Try the coconut curry chicken!
author: Ian R.

description: I must have walked by this restaurant about 50 times thinking about how I should give it a try. Came in on a Monday around 2pm for their lunch buffet and I was not disappointed! The dining room is clean and a rose adorns each table top- not bad for a place that has an all-you-can-eat lunch for $11.99. The waitstaff was friendly, attentive and I was seated immediately. I am a vegetarian and everything the lunch buffet had to offer for me was flavorful and delicious! My favorites were the aloo gobi, dal and the made to order naan! The location on Market street also provides great people watching if you're dining alone and would like some entertainment.
author: Mary S.

description:
Are we all talking about the same place? The Indian restaurant it replaced was soooo much better. 

We had the chicken tikka masala which was awful and the chicken biryani which was inedible. We ended up chucking both of them.

Sorely disappointed!!!!
author: Bilbao B.

description: I had lunch here and ate off the buffet.  First off the chai was way to sweet, all the dishes were just too bland.  Now it's true many Indian buffets are not that great just because the food is sitting out cooking for hours.  But this one was below even the normal Indian buffet.  Sorry Tara but I will try you for dinner and order off the menu and see how it goes.
author: pochini m.

description:
This place is sooo delicious.  I don't often write reviews (sorry, I'm lazy), but I had to write about this place.
I had been searching for better Indian food. The restaurant I used to love, went steadily downhill over the years, then they sold out,  becoming part of a chain.  I never went back.
Since then, I've tried many Indian restaurants & while many are tasty, they were too greasy, too far away, or too overpriced for the quality of food being served. 
Finally I found a perfect spot. It's nearby,  they even deliver,  the food has consistent every time I've returned.  
I couldn't believe they've got only 87 reviews so I wanted to add one!  I hope they stay in business for a long time!!! If you enjoy Indian food, you've got to try Tara.. 
* If you have a delivery & plan to pay by cash, make sure you won't need change. Last time the driver didn't have enough change & got to keep an extra $13 (the food smelled so good in the bag, I couldn't stay upset)!
author: Jeannine L.

description: I had delivery order last night .that was so good .order was chicken Tikka masala naan rice and Samosa that was soo good.thanks Tara for delicious food.I will order next time.
author: Bhuwan A.

description: Service was ok food was not as expected but it was vegetarian and hot served henceforth 3stars. Can do better to improve the Good food.
author: Abhishek S.

description: Fast delivery & great food! Everything was fresh & well seasoned. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Tandoori, Basmati rice, and Butter Naan.  I was very satisfied.
author: Jamie R.

description:
A friend who has been here several times took me here on a Sunday afternoon after church and it's a perfect place for lunch if you are looking for Indian food. Great all-you-can-eat for around $10 per person.  Their buffet table has a variety of fresh options including naan, curry, chicken, and, pakora. 
The Indian music videos they show on their big TV in the dining area was very entertaining to watch.
author: Will F.

description:
So good! It's our favorite place for lunch, we go nearly once a week.

Can't beat their lunch special deal. The staff are super sweet. Go go go!
author: Madelyn G.

description: We love Indian food and Tara did not disappoint. We ordered two entrees, chicken mushroom curry and yellow lentil stew. In my opinion the curry was the better of the two, though the stew was good. We were served tara with 3 sauces, one with mint overtones, another sweet-tangy and the third pepper spicy. As a side we ordered naan with garlic and another with Serrano pepper. The service was friendly and efficient. The restaurant was clean. On a big screen tv they played a loop featuring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John style Indian entertainers. It was their version of John and Olivia do Bollywood. It was horrifying, yet we couldn't stop looking at the screen. It has to be seen to be truly understood. ;)
author: Jackie A.

description: I ordered food from here and the food was great. Delivery was fast. I decided to go their for dinner and the food turned out to be average. Service was very slow. I will order again but definitely not going back. Lamd curry and chicken momos were great. Tandoori chicken and salt lassi were average.
author: Ritika K.

description: I enjoy dinning in tara yesterday after a long time again. Excellent food and service as always.
author: Shashi R.

description:
Great restaurant, great service, great food.

Nothing bad to say about this place. The restaurant was clean and classy. The service was friendly and prompt. The food was delicious.
author: Drini C.

description: Best naan I've had in a while. We ordered the chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi (cauliflower and potatoes) and saag aloo (spinach). Everything was flavorful and they didn't skimp on the chicken in the tikka masala. This spot is also great for delivery, arrived promptly and the food was still hot!!
author: Dee F.

description: Food was delicious amazing taste. Delivery-pretty fast. No utensils (I'm ok with that just a heads up). Smalllllllllll portionsssssssssss for the price. Be wary they are SMALL. Also one of my to go containers was cracked and spilled on me ;-(
author: Zelda S.

description: If you're anywhere near Castro, and want geat Indian food for a good price, this is the spot. We had Samosas, Saag Paneer, Chicken Tikka Masala, and Naan. Each was great, as was the ambiance and server. Go!
author: Rian T.

description: Delicious! Not sure if this was a chef change or the new ownership but this place has completely taken it up a notch. We had taken them off our list of places to order Indian but they're now at the top of the list!
author: Troy W.

description: This restaurant deserve five stars for its service, ambiance and food. The indian beers and the Chicken tikka masala are great choices. Suggest to make a reservation for the table next to the door with sight to market st, a lovely spot for those who like watching outside life while eating.
author: Jan Thomas H.

description: Best Indian food I've had in the bay area.  I hate to say this because I still want it to be easy to walk in and find a free table, but credit should be given where credit is due. Wonderful food. Excellent service.
author: joanna b.

description: Yummmm! Quick delivery, lamb was tasty rice good, amazing paneer naan and great samosas. Reasonably priced, free delivery. What more can you ask for? Will certainly order again. Thanks!
author: Ido K.

description: This was my first time here at Tara , a friend had told me the food was good so I decided to try it for take out. Called on the phone and was told pick up would take 10-15 minutes - perfect as I still had a quick errand to do. I ordered the chicken tikka masala - medium with basmati rice and a side order of pappadoms and raita - total  $21.54. As I had read the tikka masala was indeed very good as was the raita and pappadoms. I will definitely be coming back to try other things.
author: lyn m.

description: Ordered delivery and was pleasantly surprised that the food arrived quickly and was really tasty. Too many Indian places don't get the basics right but this was legit: garlic naan, raita and butter chicken were delish. Haven't been to the restaurant but definitely ordering delivery from here again!
author: Parag M.

description: Best Indian I have come across in the city.  The deliver to most parts of the city too.
author: Kris F.

description:
This is the best Indian restaurant in the city.after long time I came back this restaurant because there was new management and all staff members are new.l came last night with my family at this restaurant . I found hear new dishes and I want to try it. I order chicken achari tikka , methi chicken, karahi lamb and chilli chicken and naan . Oh my god that food was make me crazy. All dishes are delicious and out of the world. I order first the appetizer the momo of chicken it was more delicious.   
At this restaurants all kinds of food was delicious I don't know how to make it they I love they're all food service also friendly I love them all staff. I well come back this Tara Indian cuisine restaurant. Great food and friendly service . I never forget them see you soon Tara Indian cuisine .
author: Krishna K.

description:
I had no idea indian food could be so fresh and rich. Ive been to a few different indian restaurants around town (pakwan, alhamra, shalimar, little dehli, dosa, udipi palace, kasa) and i would have to say that tara is my new favorite. 
After reading the reviews, i decided to get the bengan bartha. Even though it isnt my regular dish- i loved it. The mango lassi tasted richer than other lassis in the past. I dont know how they do it, but i have been converted!  Thanks tara
author: Cin D.

description: Not sure how this place has got 4.5 starts. One of the worst Indian restaurants in SF. Terrible food and bad service. The food is not at all authentic and you definitely don't get what you pay for..
author: Diivs B.

description: I have read some of the reviews and it is hard to believe given that I have visited this resturant more than 20 times and not I have bad experience .so I truly recommend it to everyone.The food quality and taste are amazing and they never dissapointed.
author: Rose S.

description: This is our favorite Indian spot! We always order from them and their delivery is fast and the food is AMAZING! Each time we order, we try something new from the menu and have loved ALL of it! The Butter Chicken Masala is to die for. YUM!
author: Maggie C.

description:
Enjoyed a fun late dinner at the Tara recently. 

The tables were prepared with clean white table clothes and adorned with fresh roses to set the mood. 

For dinner, we ordered the delicious lamb shank and coconut chicken curry severed with fresh rice. The food was amazing! We also sampled the light fluffy garlic naan bread a must with every dish.

The service was excellent! The staff are friendly and made every effort to ensure their guest are happy. 

Can't wait to return.
author: Crissy W.

description: My favorite Indian place. Chicken is moist and flavorful, naan is soft and delicious...Indian cuisine is my favorite of all, and Tara is my favorite place to get it! Cannot recommend highly enough.
author: Rajesh S.

description: Finally, a great English restaurant in SF! Pappadams (how do you spell that?! I have seen literally infinite varieties...) were crisped / crimped to perfection. Chicken tikka masala was solid, vegetable biriani was exceptional, and the keema naan was very good. Indian music, white table cloths -- Tara is a taste of Brick Lane on Market Street. Thank you! Finally!
author: Jonny P.

description: Came here for lunch with my family recently and I will NOT be returning.  First off, the lunch buffet selection was very limited and the food was mediocre.  There was one server who appeared grumpy and seemed annoyed when I asked if some of the empty trays would be refilled.  When we asked for more naan the server was rude and commented that we had already received 3 - we were a party of 4!  When we said "excuse me" he then commented again that they usually only provide 2 per table.  I've been to many many many Indian buffets the last 20 years of my life and this is the first time that a server has made a comment when asking for more naan.  He was quite rude.  The fresh naan was excellent - that's where they get the one star.  I can get excellent naan at other establishments where the servers are friendly and professional.  Again, I will not be returning here..ever.  I will spend my hard-earned money elsewhere.
author: Cynthia H.

description: Finally!!! Good Indian food in San Francisco. Not sure why it's been so hard to find, but coming from someone who grew up in London, I can vouch for this place being awesome. Go. You won't be disappointed.
author: Mike D.

description: Very good food! I ordered online, the delivery was faster than expected. I will definitely order here again. I recommend it.
author: Michèle B.

description: I had a great experience! I ordered a large amount for a company party, never ordering from here I was a little apprehensive to try something new. They did a great job, the food was on point and everybody loved the food. I will be a returning customer, so thank for all your help Tara Indian Cuisine:)
author: Ninette A.

description: Great chicken tikka masala and butter naan!  This is my go to Indian restaurant in SF.
author: Diana H.

description:
Finally a delicious Indian restaurant in SF! 

So yummy and great service. Quickly moved up to our favorite Indian restaurant. Super flavorful! 

Order the shrimp vindaloo and chicken tikka masala...so good!
author: Candace D.

description:
We had our food delivered so can't speak to restaurant atmosphere. 
Overall, really good.  Price point = quality.  Perfect portion size.  

Chicken Tikka Masala -4 stars (great spice)
Garlic Naan - 3.5 stars (not super fresh)
Saag Paneer - 4.5 stars (incredibly fresh)
Samosa -  4 stars
Mixed grill - 3 stars (lamb was tough, chicken overcooked) 

Food arrived hot.  Will order again and try different items.
author: Amy B.

description: We visited two days ago. The restaurant was not busy and we were entertained by Bollywood music videos (not too loud) - a nice change from the sports screens that infect most US restaurants. The waiting staff were incredibly attentive and friendly. We talked to them a while, they were both from Nepal. We ordered the meat Thali for 2 which was very very tasty and generous in proportion - so much so that we took quite a lot away and had it for lunch the next day. We will definitely eat here again if/when we go back to San Francisco.
author: Graham P.

description:
Dinner review!
I usually don't write review but this restaurant made me to write.
Very exceptional indian food, one of the best indian food i ever had in bay area.
I went around 7:10PM, the restaurant was almost full, waiters were very attentive and good customer service. I ordered lamb shank, garlic naan and chicken momo. The portion of the food was good enough for two people. Lamb was perfectly cooked and delicious. garlic naan was amazing and chicken momo was juicy with indian spices, you should try it. Definitely I will go back again, this is one of the SF most try once place.
author: Aj K.

description: Pretty delish overall - we ordered a chicken tikka masala, lamb curry and mutter paneer with rice and serrano chili naan.  The mutter paneer didn't have much flavor, but the other dishes were really tasty. The service was helpful and fast. Definitely recommend!
author: S C.

description: Love the food every single time!! Chicken Tikka marsala is amazing and loving the lamb curry too, you don't want to miss this food experience! Friendly service, great atmosphere, and really nice owners!
author: Terilyn T.

description: Excellent food! Fabulous service and comfortable atmosphere. I tried the chicken tikka masala, rice, garlic Naan, vegetable somosa, and mango lassi. Best Indian food in a long time!
author: Michaela B.

description: This has to be one of the best Indian restaurants in San Francisco, if not on the West Coast. The masalas are excellent, with a much richer, multi-layered flavor than is found in many other good restaurants. Great rice and very good naan. The waiters were great and made us feel very welcome. They even treated us with a free desert. Prices are very reasonable. If I lived in San Francisco, I would definitely come back again and again. Highly recommended!
author: Jeppe H.

description: I thought this was a decent Indian cuisine option. It has not been the best, nor near the worst. The Naan was amazing. We ordered tandoori and chicken Marsala both of which were flavored well. They were completely attentive and interacted with our children which always is a plus. Clean, courteous and did not feel rushed in the slightest.
author: Erin S.

description: This restaurant was an accidental find as we were walking down Market Street, but I'm glad we stopped in. The food was delicious and our waiter was very friendly. Try the chicken tikka masala, momo and veggie korma. I'm picky about Indian food - and found this restaurant to be very good and well priced!
author: Erin S.

description: Delicious!  We were very happy to have leftovers for the next day - having got carried away with the menu we ordered far too much!  Definitely going to become our go-to spot for Indian food!
author: Claire C.

description: Exceptional food! Must try their coconut naan and lamb curry. Staff were pretty pleasant and were extremely helpful.
author: Bipashna A.

description: Ordered delivery- food came quickly and was delicious! We had the butter chicken, dal makhani (SO good), and the samosas. I think I found my new regular spot.
author: Jessica O.

description: Tara Indian Cuisine is a great restaurant.  This is where I take my friends when I  want to enjoy the dining experience because the service is amazing, and the food has a lot of flavor to it--they're not afraid to make it spicy.  On the weekends I like to come for the lunch buffet so I can really get a good variety, and I'm glad that it comes with a really fresh salad.  A few times Arun, the cook, has even made me original dishes when I asked him to surprise me.  Also, the restaurant has a very charming ambiance because of the largely wrought figures decorating the walls; they look like characters out of the Mahabhrata.  I went there recently to celebrate my fiftieth birthday.
author: Kai M.

description: Good, solid food, tastefully prepared. Lovely decor, white tablecloths. Service was fine, waiters were friendly. No cutting edge food here, but it was very tasty. I would return.
author: Patti H.

description: I work close to this restaurant and one day after work, I had a hankering for some Indian cuisine so I stopped by and I'm glad I did! The lamb shank I ordered was tender and had so much flavor. The garlic naan bread had great texture and flavor. The cumin rice was delicious and so was the mango lasi. Good portion too--had plenty of left overs to take home. Staff was super friendly and attentive. And the place has a cozy ambiance.
author: Jennifer V.

description: Only 2 criticism, 1) rice portion small, 2) tikka masala was a little heavy on the tomato flavor. Otherwise it was amazing! Great customer service, great atmosphere, great food, and great location. I love Spicy Bite, but with Tara being so much closer and both are comparable restaurants. It'll be even more rare for me to get out to Spicy Bite. If you don't know if Spicy Bite and are looking for Indian food check them out as well as Tara.  Both are phenomenal cuisine!
author: Jason C.

description: This is based on a delivery experience through eat 24 I ordered the chicken momos and chicken biryani. There was on old number on eat 24 and the delivery person was trying to contact me. He had already tired several times and left, when I eventually got to him he was kind enough to come back and deliver and was very polite. The food was great! The right spice and flavor... The sides of chutney and yogurt were very well made as well. Will definitely try out other stuff on their menu.
author: Tanya K.

description: Went there for lunch buffet thinking it is a Nepalese restaurant, may be because they mentioned the word Nepal on their website, but turned out to be an average Indian restaurant, nothing special about the food or the service.
author: Maheep S.

description: Good no-frills indian food, had a great meal here. We got the thali for two and added malai kopta and parata to share between 3 people, a little disappointed that the thali didn't come in the traditional metallic serving bowls but just as an assortment of dishes, but everything was delicious nonetheless. Deducted one star because the place gets really stuffy with the fumes from the dishes and no open windows.
author: Noa E.

description: The food here is so good, and the lunch special keeps me coming back.  I love it.  The vegetarian special is excellent, and it is a lot of food, but not humongous and disgusting.  It is just right.  And it smells so good in there.  Excellent Indian food, for sure.
author: Mister M.

description: I have ordered a couple of times from this place. Super quick delivery (25-30 mins). And the food is good too. I like the garlic naan. Decently priced as well. I hope they keep up the good food quality and service in the future as well .
author: Raktim M.

description: This was my first meal in San Francisco. Tasty Indian food.i had the Chicken Tikka Masala it was solid.Service was good. Prices mid-range. And very reasonable..food is very authentic..try their biryani chicken kabab or lamb chops!! dont miss the kheer!!If you are looking for something ethnic and local, trying to avoid the typical tourist fare, this was great Indian food. In that you can sit at a table, then head up to the counter to order. However the food is too good.I had a number of dishes--all quite delicious. I felt better for getting to eat so many non veg dishes when so much in the area for the authentic biryani.
author: Abhinav P.

description: I found Tara by yelp.i never got chance to go there . Today I went there for lunch . There was lunch special veg and nonveg. I got veg special was saag paneer daal and aloo go I with naan and rice . That was so good .thanks Tara for delicious lunch I will be back again
author: Khem G.

description: Service is good and food is fantastic.  My husband and I shared the lamb tikka and chicken korma. The spice was perfect, not too hot.  Would definitely recommend to friends and will return.
author: Bonny S.

description: It's embarrassing how often I come here for take out. I have those moments where I worry that one day I will be greeted like Miranda on Sex in the City and then be too ashamed to ever show my face there again.... but they are SO nice here and I believe that they really value their "regulars." Prices are great and the food is my favorite in the city. You know how with some curries, when you open the plastic container there is a layer of grease chillin on top that you aren't sure if you should try to drain or mix in?..... they don't have that!!! Their curries are so smooth, everything I have ordered is so delicious and I find myself craving their food! Seriously love this place, and am about to place an order right now.
author: Rory F.

description: Best Indian food I have ever had. Flavors are great and really know how to make some of the more simple dishes pop. I can't eat cilantro and Tara is always very understanding and accommodating. Best naan bread ever, so fresh and flavorful! Won't eat anywhere else after stumbling upon this place a month ago, have been back 3 times!
author: Relle C.

description: My girl had a cold. I tried to order take out for her. Servers told me they had no take out boxes at all. Turned me away. I used to love Bombay the place that was there before. I live around the corner , could have spent a lot of money there but the servers were too rude to let a guy have some to go. BTW we always tip take out or not, so dudes lost.
author: Willy G.

description: Wow. Why did I wait 17 years to go here? Best Indian in SF, easily. Beats Indian Oven, especially in authenticity. Did you know that Tara Indian makes their tikka sauce by using only tomatoes without skin, and hand removing the seeds? The result is the most buttery sauce I've ever had. Naan is long, thin, not fat bread like they want to fill you up. Kashmiri Chicken is the most popular chicken, and I easily saw why. Get a masala chai tea. I ate so much, never felt bloated, and will be going back soon. One of the best kept secrets of the neighborhood.
author: Sam G.

description: Best food delivery I've had in San Francisco in quite awhile!  Everything arrived hot and tasted good.   Our favorites included the Serrano Chili Nan, Mushroom Mattar, Daal Saag, Mango Lassi, and Mango Chutney.  Friendly delivery!
author: Mark C.

description: WE have lived in San Francisco for 11 years and haven't successfully found an Indian joint that we love--so glad we found TARA!!! Under brand new management, the space is still a bit rough around the edges but the food is FANTASTIC!  The servers and management are warm, considerate and very friendly with our kids.  We ordered the tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala and saag paneer--all cooked and seasoned to perfection!  The naan was piping hot, soft and melted in our mouths.  It was definitely a five star experience in many ways.  We will return again and again!
author: Sheila S.

description: This place has redeemed itself with new management and name! The flavorsome dishes and great service!! Will be the go to Indian restaurant for many!
author: Ranjeev S.

description: Ordered delivery; chicken tikka masala and some other lamb thing that I forget. The entrees were good, the rice was fragrant and delicious, the naan was good. No papadam on the menu though, bummer.
author: Jake M.

description: Great food and fast delivery.  Now my go to Indian restaurant in Sf!
author: N.I. G.

description: ***** from my side....I have been many restaurants in sfo but Tara is good and ppl inside also very friendly and chicken curry & chicken tikka masala is very delicious and lamb shank is my fav ........sfo top and delicious Indian food cuisine
author: Saikrishna N.

description: I've ordered from Tara through Eat24 twice in the past month! They are extremely quick with delivery and it's definitely some of the best Indian food I've ever had. Piping hot and perfect amount of spice. I've had the butter chicken, lamb vindaloo and saag paneer -- all worth it, just depends on your mood. :)
author: Margaret H.

description: I work nearby and decided to pop in for some Indian food late one Friday night. It was pretty packed and smelled delicious. We ordered the samosas as an appetizer, garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, basmati rice, and malai kofta. Service was prompt and the food was great. I will be back!!
author: Ava M.

description: Great food and large portions for an extremely reasonable price on Market Street. Service was top-notch!
author: Brian S.

description: A lovely Indian restaurant in my neighborhood. Conveniently located on Market, delicious food and outstanding service. They even had a little rose on every table and the roses were PERFECT! I thought they were fake. Anyway, that made me happy. It's the little things! Nice job, Tara.
author: Rina M.

description: Here is one of the best Indian resteraunts we've been to in the city along with the best service! Got there and though this may be expensive place since it looked so pretty and upscale with white table cloths, candles, and a rose on the tables.. but on contrary, it was rather inexpensive. We ordered veggie momos and they were the best we've ever had!! Chock full of veggies, cooked perfectly along with a delicious sauce. And yummiest mushroom mutter, rice, chilli naan, chai tea.. Everything we tasted was sooo delicious! And everyone working  there was so nice and extremely attentive giving the best service. Can't wait to return!! 5*!
author: Julie V.

description: Several tables ordered Tara special at once resulting in a very smoky atmosphere for just a bit with sizzling all around!  Best dish overall although the lamb spinach and dumplings were also very good.  Great yogurt dips and generous wine pours.  Great service!  May wish to have desert elsewhere rather than have rice pudding.
author: Joanne C.

description: Enjoyed New Years Eve dinner here. Excellent and friendly service. The chicken korma and navaratna korma were excellent, as was the bhindi. Loved it and we departed with full tummies and happy faces. A great way to close out 2015.
author: Tom G.

description: A fairly large group of us wandered in on a Friday not long after they opened- they were courteous, welcoming and just great- the food was delicious and we had a great time. Will definitely go back and recommend to friends.!!
author: Kat F.

description: Extremely friendly service, delicious tastes/textures. We got the Thai for 2 but will likely be back for everything else.
author: T Z.

description: Best Indian food I've had in SF. The paneer naan dipped in the lamb curry with chutney was one of the best things to happen to me so far this year
author: Chris L.

description: We have been trying a lot of Indian restaurants recently to find a good one, and I think we did. This restaurant is delicious. They are perfect with the "heat" when you ask for spicy or medium. The naan is amazing and so are the chicken dishes. Eat here if you want some great Indian food.
author: Alex M.
